page.title: 01WALLINGTON & CROYDON 1985
page.content: This block has areas of great contrast. The western part which is Wallington, Beddington and part of Mitcham is mainly open land - parks, golf course, and grassland - and the parkland in particular is very beaut- ful with rivers and small lakes and an exceptionally wide variety of trees. The eastern section is in an industrial part of Croydon. In the survey we have tried to show the differences by portraying the life styles of people in each section - from young children at school, their parents at work, and the older gener- ation too. Opportunities for both work and leisure differ widely across this block and we have tried to show this in the photographs as well as the script.
